subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Founder's Shadow: How Leaders Shape Culture
description: A quick win: understand The Founder's Shadow: How Leaders Shape Culture.

hook.text: Every employee watches what the CEO doesâ€”not what they say. A founder who works weekends creates a weekend-work culture.

buildup.text: Edgar Schein, the father of organizational culture, said culture is the shadow of the leader.

discovery.text: If the founder yells in meetings, yelling becomes normal. If they admit mistakes, vulnerability becomes safe.

twist.text: As companies grow, the founder's shadow reaches fewer people. Middle managers become the real culture carriers.

climax.text: Satya Nadella transformed Microsoft by shifting from 'know-it-all' to 'learn-it-all' cultureâ€”starting with himself.

punchline.text: Culture doesn't come from a deck. It comes from you.
